content.question: What am I looking for in a job?
content.answer: The ability work with a modern tech stack (ideally React based), where I can add maximise my value in a senior role. I would like a voice when it comes technology strategy, team processes and coding standards. I also find great enjoyment in helping others grow around me, through line-management or informal tutelage.

content.question: What are my best professional qualities?
content.answer: Leading a team from the front, delivering a high quality solution and an efficient problem solving mentality.

content.question: Am I open to contracting roles?
content.answer: Certainly, depending on location, remote working options and compensation. For duration of contract, ideally would not be under 6 months.

content.question: What job locations would be acceptable?
content.answer: Within commutable distance from SP11 - Newbury, Basingstoke, Southampton, Swindon, Reading, Bracknell, Oxford, London - see below

content.question: What about London based roles?
content.answer: Yes, with caveats. I'm currently ~2 hours each way from London, so commuting 5 days a week is a non-starter. Remote-working options would be a must, with easy transport links from Waterloo/Clapham Junction.

content.question: What level of Line Management experience do I have?
content.answer: I started whilst at IBM with a single developer. When working at CognitoIQ I managed a team of 11. I was responsible for goal setting, 1-to-1's, appraisals and salary review. This has continued into my current role at MMT, where at manage a smaller group many of whom are line managers themselves.

content.question: What experience do I have leading a team?
content.answer: I have lead teams on a day-to-day basis on my last two roles. This consists of defining team processes, engaging with stakeholders, delivering estimates, planning work and ensuring deliverables are met.

content.question: I am willing to re-locate for a role?
content.answer: No. Aside from life changing compensation and you will need to convince my partner.

testing.title: Quality assurance
paragraphs: On recent projects, I have been brought in as a source of testing expertise. I have been driving for unit and integration testing of components to give confidence of their performance in production.
I have conducted a number of sessions on how testing should drive our work, not be an afterthought to placate business stakeholders.

I aim to construct robust tests from a consumer perspective and not to dissect implementation details. Doing so reduces both false negatives and false positives, thus eroding confidence in your testing strategy.

paragraphs: I always aim to lead a team from the front, attempting to balance meeting team deliverables with enabling growth of the individual. I enjoy being the point of contact with stakeholders, reducing noise for others and in doing so aiding productivity.
I have a strong estimation and planning skills, with the ability to balance priorities of multiple projects. Ability to breakdown a large piece of work in discreet sections to aid delivery.
I have experience in managing a team, completing individual appraisals and running interview sessions.

techStack.title: Tech stack
paragraph: This site is built with React ‚öõÔ∏è and Gatsby üçæ, using styled components from Emotion üë©‚Äçüé§.
React is a Javascript library maintained by Facebook that is used for constructing user interfaces.
Gatsby is a React-based static site generator. This, alongside code splitting, intelligent image loading and asset optimisation leads to fast page loading times.
Emotion is a library designed for writing CSS in JavaScript. This removes the need for a global style-sheet and allows for co-location of style nearer to where it used.
I have created a "atomic hierarchy" to aid abstraction and reuse throughout the application. In the future this component library may be published in a open-source NPM repository.
All code (apart from React/Gatsby/Emotion dependencies) is my own and has been written from scratch.

golf.title: Golf/Ice hockey
bulletPoints: I have played golf since I was a child, I find it an excellent way spend time outdoors and focus my mind away from all outside distractions.
I find that golf has a way of picking you up when you are down, while also checking your ego if you act pridefully.

Although I have never played Ice Hockey, I have always enjoyed watching the sport, as I am a keen ice skater myself. I have travelled to various cities in Europe and North America to watch games and I am a keen supporter of the Toronto Mapleleafs.

borneo.title: Raleigh International - Borneo
bulletPoints: I volunteered as a Project Manager on a 4 month expedition to Borneo. During my time away I worked on two projects in addition to exploring in the Primary Rainforest with local Army guides.

I aided the construction of a research station in Danum Valley Rainforest. This was logically very challenging due to the remote location and the fact that all supplies needed to be hiked in. While complex, it was very rewarding as we were allowed access to forest beyond where the general public were allowed.

I was involved in the construction of a Primary school in the mountain top village of Linka Buagyan. A benefit of this project was the opportunity to teach daily English classes with the local children. The sunrises were also spectacular on a daily basis as seen at the top of the page.
This was my first official experience of pastural care of junior volunteers when working away from home in an alien environment.
